labels.name: review/triage-pending
labels.description: PRs opened by external contributors that are waiting for the 1st review

body:
This document outlines the design for a generic anti-squatting system to prevent username squatting in the Gno ecosystem. The system implements sealed-bid auctions for high-value names and provides dispute resolution mechanisms.
fix issue #2727

title: fix: compile regx before use

labels.name: :package: :robot: gnovm
labels.description: Issues or PRs gnovm related

labels.name: :package: :globe_with_meridians:  tendermint v2
labels.description: Issues or PRs tm2 related

body:
Because Compile() happens dynamically run-time, it can cause concurrent map writes: https://github.com/gnolang/gno/pull/4568

This PR fixes it by making sure the regexes we use at runtime are already compiled during init.

This improves efficiency by not requiring a map lookup each time.

title: gnovm: using escape character "\x1b" in test.Run name crash

labels.name: üêû bug
labels.description: Something isn't working

body: ## Using escape character ("\x1b" or "\033") in `t.Run` function in testing make testing crash ### Description you can not use a string that contains the escape character in the first arg of `t.Run` in a test file: ### Your environment go version: `go1.24.4 linux/amd64` uname: `Linux prout 5.15.167.4-microsoft-standard-WSL2 #1 SMP Tue Nov 5 00:21:55 UTC 2024 x86_64 GNU/Linux` distro `Debian` gno version: `ufmt-enhancement.2650+5afa07849` ### Steps to reproduce ```go package foo import "testing" func TestCrash(t *testing.T) { str := "\x1b[31mhello\x1b[m" println(str) // no crash t.Run(str, func(t *testing.T) { return }) } ``` ### Expected behaviour should just work like ``` === RUN TestCrash hello --- PASS: TestCrash (0.00s) ``` (hello would be in red) ### Actual behaviour ### Logs ``` panic: invalid slice index 1 > 0 Stacktrace: rewrite(name) testing/base/match.gno:0 t.Run(str,(const-type testing/base.testingFunc)(func(t *(typeval{testing/base.T})){ ... })) testing/base/testing.gno:162 fn(t<~VPBlock(1,0)>) gno.land/p/demo/ufmt/ufmt_test.gno:249 tRunner(t,test.F,verbose) testing/base/testing.gno:410 RunTest(,true,false,(const-type testing/base.InternalTest)) testing/base/testing.gno:319 ``` ### Proposed solution in testing.Run there is this function `rewrite` ```go func (t *T) Run(name string, f testingFunc) bool { fullName := t.name + "/" + rewrite(name) // here ... } ``` that looks like this ```go func rewrite(s string) string { b := []byte{} for _, r := range s { switch { case isSpace(r): b = append(b, '_') case !unicode.IsPrint(r): s := simpleQuoteRune(r) // *here b = append(b, s[1:len(s)-1]...) default: b = append(b, string(r)...) } } return string(b) } ``` while debugging, the result of the `simpleQuoteRune` call (where is the `*here`) is `"."` when using the string with escape characters so when doing `s[1:len(s)-1]` its doing `(".")[1:1-1]` which is a range `[1:0]` and crashes with `panic: invalid slice index 1 > 0` why ? because the function simpleQuoteRune is litterally ```go // simpleQuoteRune does not follow the original strconv.QuoteRune. func simpleQuoteRune(r rune) string { return "." } ``` what is it used for ? why does someone coded this so this switch case will always crash ???

title: feat(gnovm): custom go parser for gas counting and nesting limits #2

labels.name: :package: :robot: gnovm
labels.description: Issues or PRs gnovm related

body:
This is a refreshed attempt similar to #4027.

Import the Go parser from the standard library. We will then customize it to allow gas estimation during parsing, and also put hard limits on nesting for security purposes.

A Makefile to facilitate the import from the standard library and maintaining the custom patch is provided.

More to come in subsequent changes.

title: feat: Gas cost depending on frame size

labels.name: :package: :robot: gnovm
labels.description: Issues or PRs gnovm related

body:
## PR Description
#### Summary:
This PR introduces a gas cost for increasing the maximum number of frame stack entries during execution. As a result, calling recursive functions will incur a higher gas cost compared to performing the equivalent logic using loops.
#### Key Changes:

Added a new parameter MaxFrames to the Machine struct to track the maximum number of frames encountered during execution.

Updated PushFrameBasic and PushFrameCall to check if the current number of frames exceeds the previous maximum. If it does, we consume gas (currently set to 1 unit, but configurable).

#### Context & Considerations
- Initially, we attempted to account for the size of each frame (values, arguments, blocks, etc.), but this concern is already addressed in #4546

title: feat(gnodev): `-txs-file=` detect dependencies
body:
This change extract the unique addresses and contracts from the provided jsonl file and automatically load or charge them.

Fixes #4382

title: How to configure multi-node startup?

## Description

title: feat(examples): add samcrew daokit

labels.name: :receipt:  package/realm
labels.description: Tag used for new Realms or Packages.

body:
Adds the samourai daokit in examples, there is a [documentation `README.md`](https://github.com/gnolang/gno/blob/7704a12bd09c53cd9cd77b4ad8a881fa4d77294b/examples/gno.land/p/samcrew/daokit/README.md) in `/p/samcrew/daokit`

tl;dr:
- `/p/samcrew/daocond`: conditions system to go beyond threshold voting systems in daos
- `/p/samcrew/daokit`: dao core responsible to tie conditions, resources and proposals together
- `/p/samcrew/basedao`: daokit extension that adds the concept of members and roles on top of daokit
- `/r/samcrew/daodemo`: demo dao realm using basedao

daokit has already been used in [production for zenao during the hyperhacktive film festival event](https://zenao.io/event/15)

This is a stable snapshot of https://github.com/samouraiworld/gnodaokit

title: Add `gnokey version` subcommand

labels.name: üó∫Ô∏ègood first issueüó∫Ô∏è
labels.description: Ideal for newcomer contributors

labels.name: :package: :mountain:  gno.land
labels.description: Issues or PRs gno.land package related

type.name: Feature
type.description: A request, idea, or new functionality

body:
## Description

One of the most common issues we keep seeing with chain clients is that they have an outdated version of core tools running when interacting with the latest `master` chain.

This task concerns adding a `gnokey version` subcommand that would display the build version and commit hash (embedded during the build process).

title: feat(misc/e2e): e2e multinode determinism

labels.name: üêπ golang
labels.description: Pull requests that update Go code

body:
Adds multinode integration testing framework to detect consensus determinism issues.

  ## Features

  - **Pure Go implementation** - Process isolation without Docker dependencies
  - **Dual usage** - Functions as both integration tests and standalone tool (useful for bisecting)
  - **Flexible scenarios** - Extensible testing library with predefined test cases
  - **TestingT interface** - Supports both `testing.T` and CLI execution

  ## Details

  The framework spins up multiple gnoland nodes (validators and non-validators) to verify consensus determinism by
  comparing AppHashes across all nodes at each height.

  While the current scenarios haven't reproduced known non-determinism issues, this provides:
  - A foundation for more complex test scenarios
  - An example implementation for custom integration tools
  - Automated regression testing for consensus determinism

  ## Usage

  ```bash
  # Run as tests
  make test # go test 

  # Run as CLI tool
  make build && ./build/e2e_multinode test
